trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SEQ_00<tab>Erenville has been waiting patiently for your arrival.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Alphinaud.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_TODO_03<tab>Wait at the designated location.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_001<tab>Oh, I could ask Namikka to cook me something afterwards...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_KRILE_000_002<tab>There are so many narrow, winding streets. But even if you get lost, all you have to do is keep heading up, and you'll arrive at the palace eventually.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_003<tab>We saw a two-headed Mamool Ja on our way here. Another claimant in the rite of succession, according to Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_004<tab>The food is amazing. A passing Mamool Ja let us try a fruit called “cherimoya” and it was just sublime.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SYSTEM_000_005<tab>Upon speaking to Erenville, several cutscenes will play in sequence.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SYSTEM_000_006<tab>It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_008<tab>I've acquainted the twins with the city as best I could in a short time.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_009<tab>Their unbridled enthusiasm made it rather difficult. Invariably something would catch their eye, spurring them to run down an alley to investigate. 'Twas like herding a pair of unruly coeurls.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_010<tab>Heh, I understand all too well. Sharlayan had the same effect on me.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_011<tab>Right, then. Now it's time we saw the inside of the palace. Papa will want to know I'm home, and to meet the allies I've chosen.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_100_011<tab>Given how impulsive he is, though, there's no telling what we might be in for...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_KRILE_000_012<tab>I know not what drives Zoraal Ja, but it engulfs him like an inferno...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_013<tab>As you just witnessed, Wuk Lamat has no great army of supporters. Not yet, at least.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_014<tab>So Koana, the Second Promise, is intent on developing his country by means of Sharlayan innovations. Given his background, I suppose it should come as no surprise.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_015<tab>That two-head claimant, Bakool Ja Ja, treats everyone around him as lesser beings. No doubt he'd try to elevate the Mamool Ja above other races should he become Dawnservant─not unlike how the Garlean Empire afforded special status to pureblood Garleans.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_016<tab>Well, so much for the brief reunion I had in mind. Papa is not one to waste time when he decides to act.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_017<tab>I'm used to it by now, of course, but others are often caught off guard. In any case, we should talk about how we're going to find the city of gold.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_018<tab>All we have to work with are the seven tablets and their connection to the Tuliyollal Saga...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_019<tab>Might I suggest first comparing the tablets against the pillars? We could check for any discrepancies between them.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>Good idea. Let's go and take a look!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_021<tab>Hm. At a glance, they seem much the same...

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_022<tab>The preparation of intricately carved tablets for every claimant must have taken considerable effort and forethought. We should consider them weighty reminders that this “contest” is no light-hearted matter.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_023<tab>I wasn't expecting events to progress <var 1A 02 /var>that<var 1A 01 /var> quickly, but I won't complain. The contest is the main reason we're here, after all.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_KRILE_000_024<tab>I won't give up until we find the golden city. For Wuk Lamat as well as myself.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_025<tab>That makes everyone.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_026<tab>Wuk Lamat─the tablets, if you would.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_027<tab>Of course!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_030<tab>Everyone has a tablet? Then let's compare them to their respective pillars. Keep an eye out for even the smallest differences...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_KRILE_000_031<tab>Unless I'm missing something, the glyphs appear to be identical.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_032<tab>The only difference being that the tablets have hollows where the keystones are to be fitted.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_033<tab>So now that we've established that the scenes are the same, where do we go from here?
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_034<tab>The Dawnservant said we were to retrace the path he walked in uniting Tural's peoples, and that we would encounter seven electors along the way...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_035<tab>Then we have the answer here in front of us: Papa's path is all laid out in the Tuliyollal Saga.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_KRILE_000_036<tab>The events the glyphs portray─do we know the exact locations where they took place?
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_037<tab>If one is close, we could go there and search for an elector. That would confirm we're on the right track.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_038<tab>Hm, let me think... The Lay of Reeds was in the nearby Hanuhanu settlement.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_039<tab>Papa took me there once. It was during festival season, and the whole village was alive with good cheer.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_040<tab>There's also the Lay of Gold. That one involved the Pelupelu village, which is about the same distance from here.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_041<tab>Before going anywhere, we should ask around about the road ahead.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_042<tab>I heard a lot of talk as we toured the city about that storm we passed through at sea. Apparently it ravaged Yok Tural several days ago.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_043<tab>Since our roads are not as well paved as Eorzea's, they're more susceptible to damage from natural disasters. If we want to avoid wasting time taking a dead-end trail, I suggest we spend a few moments making inquiries.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_044<tab>If it's information we need...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_100_044<tab>Just leave it to me! I'll bring the information to us!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_045<tab>...It would be prudent to ensure we're prepared for the journey. I'll guide you to the accommodations I've arranged.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_PESHEKWA_100_050<tab>Welcome to the For'ard Cabins!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_KRILE_000_050<tab>Oh, such lovely little cottages, and they're on the water!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_051<tab>What a comfort to have our lodgings sorted in advance.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_052<tab>Wuk Lamat said she would “bring the information” to us. I wonder what she meant by that...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_053<tab>That's right, the reservation is under Wuk Lamat's name. If you don't mind, I'll leave my companions to you.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_PESHEKWA_000_054<tab>Certainly, sir.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_055<tab>I'll go and track down the Third Promise. Once you've finished organizing your gear, you can meet us outside Xbalyav Ty'e.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_PESHEKWA_000_056<tab>Greetings, visitors to Tuliyollal, and welcome to the For'ard Cabins!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_PESHEKWA_000_057<tab>Whenever you are ready, I will show you to your rooms.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SYSTEM_000_060<tab>Await your companions and embark on the rite of succession?
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_061<tab>Trust you to be the keenest to head out, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_062<tab>But where are Erenville and Wuk Lamat, I wonder...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_063<tab>Oh good, you're all here.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_064<tab>Who might your companions be?
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_065<tab>Seeing as we needed information, I thought who better to get it from than the locals? These two hail from the villages we're thinking to visit.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_066<tab>I give you credit for taking initiative, at least.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_067<tab>What do you mean, “at least”!?
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_HANUHANUCOLLABORATOR4864_000_068<tab>I am honored that the Third Promise would seek my advice.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_PELUPELUCOLLABORATOR4864_000_069<tab>I, too, am happy to answer your questions. Any encounter might be an opportunity to do business.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_070<tab>Thank you both for your help!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_071<tab>Ah, before we begin─there will doubtless be other occasions when we need to act independently, so I brought these for the two of you.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_072<tab>What's this?
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_073<tab>'Tis called a linkpearl─a gemstone harvested from a special shell. When linked together, they allow people to communicate across great distances.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_074<tab>Is that so!? What a handy thing to have!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_076<tab>It'll be very useful on our travels. Speaking of which, I should get back to introducing my two new friends here!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_KRILE_000_080<tab>Who should we speak to first, do you think?

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ERENVILLE_000_081<tab>Wuk Lamat may not be as experienced or accomplished as her brothers, but she has an affinity for the people. For her, finding those willing to cooperate is as simple as asking.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALPHINAUD_000_082<tab>Even up close, the Hanu are remarkably similar to the Vanu. Aside from those brilliant feathers, of course.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_ALISAIE_000_083<tab>Is there a reason the Pelupelu all wear those masks...?
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_HANUHANUCOLLABORATOR4864_000_084<tab>Please, ask anything. I'll gladly tell you what I know.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_PELUPELUCOLLABORATOR4864_000_085<tab>What a stroke of luck to forge this connection to the palace. May it be the beginning of a profitable partnership...

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_086<tab>The Tuliyollal Saga features a number of Tural's clans. Two of those, the Hanuhanu and the Pelupelu, have settlements relatively close to the city, so I brought a representative of each.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_087<tab>As I mentioned before, the Hanu are a cheerful people who love their festivals. They make their appearance in the Lay of Reeds, and their home village─Ok'hanu─is located in Kozama'uka.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_088<tab>The other, smaller fellow is one of the Pelu, a clan of business-minded folk from Urqopacha. They appear in the Lay of Gold, and craft all kinds of marvelous goods in Wachunpelo, their village.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_089<tab>Now, as for deciding which village to visit first...
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_WUKLAMAT_000_090<tab>Why don't you put that adventurer's instinct of yours to work for us, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>? Pick our destination!
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SYSTEM_000_091<tab>Upon completing this quest, the main scenario will branch into two quest paths.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SYSTEM_000_092<tab>Accepting the quest from the helpful Hanu will temporarily prevent you from accepting the quest from the approachable Pelu, and vice versa.
TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SYSTEM_000_093<tab>The second quest path will become available from the respective NPC once you have completed the series of quests from the first path.

TEXT_KINGMA105_04864_SYSTEM_000_094<tab>Furthermore, story elements and quest rewards will not be affected by your initial choice of path. Speak with the NPC you prefer, and embark on the trail for the rite of succession!
